paragraphs.paragraph: 中国糖尿病足诊治指南

sentences.sentence: 中国糖尿病足诊治指南
sentences.sentence_en: Guidelines for the diagnosis and treatment of diabetic foot in China

paragraphs.paragraph_en: Guidelines for the diagnosis and treatment of diabetic foot in China

paragraphs.paragraph: 糖尿病足是导致我国糖尿病患者致残、致死的严重慢性并发症之一，其发病率高，治疗困难，花费巨大目前我国主要是参考国际足病工作者与美国糖尿病足病学组制定的指南。但是，由于我国糖尿病足具有自身的特点，因此，中国医疗保健国际交流促进会组织全国足病相关专家起草了糖尿病足诊治指南。

sentences.sentence: 糖尿病足是导致我国糖尿病患者致残、致死的严重慢性并发症之一，其发病率高，治疗困难，花费巨大目前我国主要是参考国际足病工作者与美国糖尿病足病学组制定的指南。
sentences.sentence_en: Diabetic foot is one of the serious chronic complications that causes disability and death in diabetic patients in my country. It has a high incidence rate, is difficult to treat, and is very expensive. Currently, my country mainly refers to the guidelines developed by international podiatry workers and the American Diabetic Podiatry Group.

sentences.sentence: 但是，由于我国糖尿病足具有自身的特点，因此，中国医疗保健国际交流促进会组织全国足病相关专家起草了糖尿病足诊治指南。
sentences.sentence_en: However, since diabetic foot in my country has its own characteristics, the China Medical and Health International Exchange Promotion Association organized national foot disease experts to draft guidelines for the diagnosis and treatment of diabetic foot.

paragraphs.paragraph_en: Diabetic foot is one of the serious chronic complications that cause disability and death in Chinese diabetic patients. It has a high incidence rate, is difficult to treat, and is very expensive. At present, my country mainly refers to the guidelines developed by international podiatric workers and the American Diabetic Podiatry Group. However, due to the unique characteristics of diabetic foot in my country, the China Medical and Health International Exchange Promotion Association organized national podiatry experts to draft a guideline for the diagnosis and treatment of diabetic foot.

paragraphs.paragraph: 一、糖尿病足及高危足的概念

paragraphs.paragraph_en: 1. The concept of diabetic foot and high-risk foot

paragraphs.paragraph: 糖尿病足：糖尿病患者因下肢远端神经异常和不同程度的血管病变导致的足部感染、溃疡和(或) 深层组织破坏。

sentences.sentence: 糖尿病足：糖尿病患者因下肢远端神经异常和不同程度的血管病变导致的足部感染、溃疡和(或) 深层组织破坏。
sentences.sentence_en: Diabetic foot: foot infection, ulcers and/or deep tissue destruction caused by distal nerve abnormalities and varying degrees of vascular lesions in diabetic patients.

paragraphs.paragraph_en: Diabetic foot: foot infection, ulcers and/or deep tissue destruction caused by distal nerve abnormalities and varying degrees of vascular lesions in diabetic patients.

paragraphs.paragraph: 糖尿病高危足糖尿病患者未出现足溃疡但存在周围神经病变，不管是否存在足畸形或周围动脉病变或足溃疡史或截肢(趾)史。

sentences.sentence: 糖尿病高危足糖尿病患者未出现足溃疡但存在周围神经病变，不管是否存在足畸形或周围动脉病变或足溃疡史或截肢(趾)史。
sentences.sentence_en: High-risk diabetic foot patients with diabetes do not have foot ulcers but have peripheral neuropathy, regardless of whether they have foot deformities or peripheral arterial disease or a history of foot ulcers or amputation (toe).

paragraphs.paragraph_en: High-risk diabetic foot patients with diabetes do not have foot ulcers but have peripheral neuropathy, regardless of whether they have foot deformities or peripheral arterial disease or a history of foot ulcers or amputation (toe).

paragraphs.paragraph: 国外资料显示在所有的非外伤性低位截肢手术中，糖尿病患者占40%~60%，在糖尿病相关的低位远端截肢中，有85%是发生在足部溃疡后。糖尿病患者中足部溃疡的患病率为4%~10%。国内多中心研究资料显示我国50岁以上糖尿病患者下肢动脉病变的比例为19.5%。单中心研究显示60岁以上糖尿病患者下肢动脉病变的比例为3 5.4%。我国糖尿病患者1年内新发溃疡发生率为8.1%，糖尿病足溃疡患者1年内新发溃疡发生率为31.6%

sentences.sentence_en: Domestic multi-center research data show that the proportion of lower limb artery disease in diabetic patients over 50 years old in my country is 19.5%.

sentences.sentence_en: A single-center study showed that the proportion of lower limb arterial disease in diabetic patients over 60 years old was 35.4%.

sentences.sentence: 我国糖尿病患者1年内新发溃疡发生率为8.1%，糖尿病足溃疡患者1年内新发溃疡发生率为31.6%
sentences.sentence_en: The incidence of new ulcers in diabetic patients in my country within one year is 8.1%, and the incidence of new ulcers in diabetic foot ulcer patients within one year is 31.6%.

paragraphs.paragraph_en: Foreign data show that among all non-traumatic low amputations, 40% to 60% occur in patients with diabetes, and 85% of diabetes-related low distal amputations occur after foot ulcers. The prevalence of foot ulcers in diabetic patients is 4% to 10%. Domestic multicenter research data show that the proportion of lower limb arterial disease in diabetic patients over 50 years old in my country is 19.5%. A single-center study showed that the proportion of lower limb arterial disease in diabetic patients over 60 years old is 35.4%. The incidence of new ulcers in diabetic patients in my country within one year is 8.1%, and the incidence of new ulcers in patients with diabetic foot ulcers within one year is 31.6%.

paragraphs.paragraph: 神经病变表现：患肢皮肤干而无汗，肢端刺痛、灼痛、麻木、感觉减退或缺失，呈袜套样改变，行走时脚踩棉絮感

sentences.sentence: 神经病变表现：患肢皮肤干而无汗，肢端刺痛、灼痛、麻木、感觉减退或缺失，呈袜套样改变，行走时脚踩棉絮感

entities.entity_en: Feeling of cotton wool underfoot when walking

sentences.sentence_en: Symptoms of neuropathy: dry skin without sweat, tingling, burning pain, numbness, decreased or absent sensation in the extremities, sock-like changes, and a cotton-wool feeling when walking.

paragraphs.paragraph_en: Symptoms of neuropathy: dry skin without sweat, tingling, burning pain, numbness, decreased or absent sensation in the extremities, sock-like changes, and a cotton-wool feeling when walking.

paragraphs.paragraph: 下肢缺血表现：皮肤营养不良、肌肉萎缩，皮肤干燥弹性差，皮温下降，色素沉着，肢端动脉搏动减弱或消失，患者可合并有下肢间歇跛行症状。随着病变进展，可出现静息痛，趾端出现坏疽，足跟或跖趾关节受压部位出现溃疡，部分患者可肢体感染。

sentences.sentence: 下肢缺血表现：皮肤营养不良、肌肉萎缩，皮肤干燥弹性差，皮温下降，色素沉着，肢端动脉搏动减弱或消失，患者可合并有下肢间歇跛行症状。

entities.entity: 肢端动脉搏动减弱或消失
entities.entity_en: Weak or absent arterial pulse in the extremities

sentences.sentence_en: Symptoms of lower limb ischemia include: skin malnutrition, muscle atrophy, dry skin with poor elasticity, decreased skin temperature, pigmentation, weakened or disappeared arterial pulsation in the extremities, and patients may also have symptoms of intermittent claudication in the lower limbs.

sentences.sentence: 随着病变进展，可出现静息痛，趾端出现坏疽，足跟或跖趾关节受压部位出现溃疡，部分患者可肢体感染。

entities.entity: 足跟或跖趾关节受压部位出现溃疡
entities.entity_en: Ulcers at pressure points on the heel or metatarsophalangeal joints

sentences.sentence_en: As the disease progresses, rest pain, gangrene on the toes, ulcers on the pressure sites of the heel or metatarsophalangeal joints may occur, and some patients may develop limb infections.

paragraphs.paragraph_en: Symptoms of lower limb ischemia: skin malnutrition, muscle atrophy, dry and inelastic skin, decreased skin temperature, pigmentation, weakened or absent arterial pulsation at the extremities, and patients may have symptoms of intermittent claudication in the lower limbs. As the lesion progresses, rest pain, gangrene at the toe tips, ulcers at the pressure points of the heel or metatarsophalangeal joints, and some patients may have limb infections.

paragraphs.paragraph: 糖尿病周围神经病变(diabetic peripheral neuropathy，DPN）可以通过以下几种方法得到诊断。

sentences.sentence: 糖尿病周围神经病变(diabetic peripheral neuropathy，DPN）可以通过以下几种方法得到诊断。

entities.entity: 糖尿病周围神经病变(diabetic peripheral neuropathy，DPN）

sentences.sentence_en: Diabetic peripheral neuropathy (DPN) can be diagnosed in several ways.

paragraphs.paragraph_en: Diabetic peripheral neuropathy (DPN) can be diagnosed in several ways.

paragraphs.paragraph: 1.10g尼龙丝检查法：该方法是较为简便的感觉神经检测方法，要具备一根特制的尼龙丝(其弯曲45°能够产生10g的压力)。检查开始前，通常在患者手掌或前臂试用该尼龙丝2~3次，让患者感受1 0g尼龙丝产生压力的正常感觉。测试应对双侧足部进行检查；每个检查点施压时间约2-3s，时间不宜过长；检查部位应避开胼胝、水疱和溃疡面等；建议检测点为第1、3、5趾腹，第1、3、5跖骨头处，足心，足掌外侧，足跟及足背第1、2跖骨间共10个点，患者有2个或2个以上感觉异常点则视为异常。

sentences.sentence: 1.10g尼龙丝检查法：该方法是较为简便的感觉神经检测方法，要具备一根特制的尼龙丝(其弯曲45°能够产生10g的压力)。
sentences.sentence_en: 1.10g nylon thread inspection method: This method is a relatively simple sensory nerve detection method, which requires a special nylon thread (which can generate 10g of pressure when bent at 45°).

sentences.sentence: 检查开始前，通常在患者手掌或前臂试用该尼龙丝2~3次，让患者感受1 0g尼龙丝产生压力的正常感觉。
sentences.sentence_en: Before the examination begins, the nylon thread is usually tried on the patient's palm or forearm 2 to 3 times to let the patient feel the normal feeling of pressure produced by 10g of nylon thread.

sentences.sentence: 测试应对双侧足部进行检查；每个检查点施压时间约2-3s，时间不宜过长；检查部位应避开胼胝、水疱和溃疡面等；建议检测点为第1、3、5趾腹，第1、3、5跖骨头处，足心，足掌外侧，足跟及足背第1、2跖骨间共10个点，患者有2个或2个以上感觉异常点则视为异常。
sentences.sentence_en: The test should be performed on both sides of the feet; pressure should be applied for about 2-3 seconds at each inspection point, and the time should not be too long; calluses, blisters and ulcers should be avoided; the recommended inspection points are the 1st, 3rd, and 5th toe webs, the 1st, 3rd, and 5th metatarsal heads, the center of the foot, the outside of the sole, the heel, and between the 1st and 2nd metatarsal bones on the dorsum of the foot, a total of 10 points. If the patient has 2 or more abnormal sensory points, it is considered abnormal.

paragraphs.paragraph_en: 1.10g nylon thread inspection method: This method is a relatively simple sensory nerve detection method. It requires a special nylon thread (which can generate 10g pressure when bent at 45°). Before the inspection begins, the nylon thread is usually tried 2 to 3 times on the patient's palm or forearm to let the patient feel the normal feeling of pressure generated by the 10g nylon thread. The test should be performed on both feet; the pressure time for each inspection point is about 2-3s, and the time should not be too long; the inspection site should avoid calluses, blisters and ulcers; the recommended inspection points are the 1st, 3rd, and 5th toe webs, the 1st, 3rd, and 5th metatarsal heads, the sole of the foot, the outside of the sole, the heel, and the dorsum of the foot between the 1st and 2nd metatarsal bones, a total of 10 points. If the patient has 2 or more abnormal sensory points, it is considered abnormal.

paragraphs.paragraph: 2.震动觉：该检查是对深部组织感觉的半定量检查。在进行前，首先将振动的音叉柄置于患者乳突处让其感受音叉的振动，然后分别置于双足的骨性凸起部位进行比较检查(第1跖趾关节内侧，内外踝)。

sentences.sentence: 2.震动觉：该检查是对深部组织感觉的半定量检查。
sentences.sentence_en: 2. Vibration sense: This test is a semi-quantitative test of deep tissue sensation.

sentences.sentence: 在进行前，首先将振动的音叉柄置于患者乳突处让其感受音叉的振动，然后分别置于双足的骨性凸起部位进行比较检查(第1跖趾关节内侧，内外踝)。
sentences.sentence_en: Before the test, first place the handle of the vibrating tuning fork on the patient's mastoid process so that the patient can feel the vibration of the tuning fork, and then place it on the bony protrusions of both feet for comparative examination (inside the first metatarsophalangeal joint, inner and outer ankles).

paragraphs.paragraph_en: 2. Vibration sense: This test is a semi-quantitative test of deep tissue sensation. Before the test, first place the handle of a vibrating tuning fork on the patient's mastoid process to let the patient feel the vibration of the tuning fork, and then place it on the bony protrusions of both feet for comparative examination (the medial side of the first metatarsophalangeal joint, the medial and lateral malleolus).

paragraphs.paragraph: 3.踝反射、痛觉、温度觉：这3种检查方法，也可以应用于糖尿病周围神经病变的诊断。

sentences.sentence: 3.踝反射、痛觉、温度觉：这3种检查方法，也可以应用于糖尿病周围神经病变的诊断。
sentences.sentence_en: 3. Ankle reflex, pain sensation, and temperature sensation: These three examination methods can also be used in the diagnosis of diabetic peripheral neuropathy.

paragraphs.paragraph_en: 3. Ankle reflex, pain sensation, and temperature sensation: These three examination methods can also be used in the diagnosis of diabetic peripheral neuropathy.

paragraphs.paragraph: 4.神经传导速度(nerve conduction velocity，NCV) ：过去被认为是DPN诊断的“金标准”，通常认为有两项或以上NCV减慢者结合其他症状体征及辅助检查可考虑存在DPN。

sentences.sentence: 4.神经传导速度(nerve conduction velocity，NCV) ：过去被认为是DPN诊断的“金标准”，通常认为有两项或以上NCV减慢者结合其他症状体征及辅助检查可考虑存在DPN。

entities.entity: 神经传导速度(nerve conduction velocity，NCV)

sentences.sentence_en: 4. Nerve conduction velocity (NCV): In the past, it was considered the "gold standard" for the diagnosis of DPN. It is generally believed that patients with two or more slowed NCVs combined with other symptoms, signs and auxiliary examinations may be considered to have DPN.

paragraphs.paragraph_en: 4. Nerve conduction velocity (NCV): In the past, it was considered the "gold standard" for the diagnosis of DPN. It is generally believed that patients with two or more slowed NCVs combined with other symptoms, signs and auxiliary examinations may be considered to have DPN.

paragraphs.paragraph: 1.体检：通过触诊，扪及股、腘、足背动脉和 (或) 胫后动脉搏动了解下肢血管病变；通过Buerger 试验了解下肢缺血情况。

sentences.sentence: 1.体检：通过触诊，扪及股、腘、足背动脉和 (或) 胫后动脉搏动了解下肢血管病变；通过Buerger 试验了解下肢缺血情况。
sentences.sentence_en: 1. Physical examination: palpate the femoral, popliteal, dorsalis pedis and/or posterior tibial artery pulsations to understand lower limb vascular lesions; perform the Buerger test to understand lower limb ischemia.

paragraphs.paragraph_en: 1. Physical examination: palpate the femoral, popliteal, dorsalis pedis and/or posterior tibial artery pulsations to understand lower limb vascular lesions; perform the Buerger test to understand lower limb ischemia.

paragraphs.paragraph: 2.皮肤温度检查：红外线皮肤温度检查是一种简单、实用的评估局部血供的方法，最好采用温度差判断肢体血供。

sentences.sentence: 2.皮肤温度检查：红外线皮肤温度检查是一种简单、实用的评估局部血供的方法，最好采用温度差判断肢体血供。
sentences.sentence_en: 2. Skin temperature check: Infrared skin temperature check is a simple and practical method to evaluate local blood supply. It is best to use temperature difference to judge limb blood supply.

paragraphs.paragraph_en: 2. Skin temperature check: Infrared skin temperature check is a simple and practical method to evaluate local blood supply. It is best to use temperature difference to judge limb blood supply.

paragraphs.paragraph: 3.踝动脉-肱动脉血压比值，又称踝肱指数(ankle brachial index，ABI) ：ABI反映的是肢体的血运状况，正常值为0.9~1.3，0.71~0.89为轻度缺血，0.5-0.7为中度缺血，<0.5为重度缺血，重度缺血的患者容易发生下肢(趾)坏疽。如果踝动脉收缩压过高，如高于200mmHg(1mmHg= 0.133kPa) 或ABI>1.3，则应高度怀疑患者有下肢动脉钙化，部分ABI正常患者，可能存在假阴性，可采用平板运动试验或趾臂指数(TBI）测定来纠正。

sentences.sentence: 3.踝动脉-肱动脉血压比值，又称踝肱指数(ankle brachial index，ABI) ：ABI反映的是肢体的血运状况，正常值为0.9~1.3，0.71~0.89为轻度缺血，0.5-0.7为中度缺血，<0.5为重度缺血，重度缺血的患者容易发生下肢(趾)坏疽。如果踝动脉收缩压过高，如高于200mmHg(1mmHg= 0.133kPa) 或ABI>1.3，则应高度怀疑患者有下肢动脉钙化，部分ABI正常患者，可能存在假阴性，可采用平板运动试验或趾臂指数(TBI）测定来纠正。
sentences.sentence_en: 3. Ankle artery-brachial artery blood pressure ratio, also known as ankle brachial index (ABI): ABI reflects the blood flow of the limbs. The normal value is 0.9~1.3, 0.71~0.89 is mild ischemia, 0.5-0.7 is moderate ischemia, and <0.5 is severe ischemia. Patients with severe ischemia are prone to lower limb (toe) gangrene. If the ankle artery systolic pressure is too high, such as higher than 200mmHg (1mmHg= 0.133kPa) or ABI>1.3, the patient should be highly suspected of lower limb artery calcification. Some patients with normal ABI may have false negatives, which can be corrected by treadmill exercise test or toe brachial index (TBI) measurement.

paragraphs.paragraph_en: 3. Ankle artery-brachial artery blood pressure ratio, also known as ankle brachial index (ABI): ABI reflects the blood flow of the limbs. The normal value is 0.9~1.3, 0.71~0.89 is mild ischemia, 0.5-0.7 is moderate ischemia, and <0.5 is severe ischemia. Patients with severe ischemia are prone to lower limb (toe) gangrene. If the ankle artery systolic pressure is too high, such as higher than 200mmHg (1mmHg= 0.133kPa) or ABI>1.3, the patient should be highly suspected of lower limb artery calcification. Some patients with normal ABI may have false negatives, which can be corrected by treadmill exercise test or toe brachial index (TBI) measurement.

paragraphs.paragraph: 4.经皮氧分压(transcutaneous oxygenpressure，TcPO2)：正常人足背TcPO2>40 mmHg；如<30mmHg提示周围血液供应不足，足部易发生溃疡，或已有的溃疡难以愈合；如TcPO2<20mmHg，足溃疡几乎没有愈合的可能。

entities.entity_en: Ulcers that are difficult to heal

sentences.sentence_en: 4. Transcutaneous oxygen pressure (TcPO2): In normal people, TcPO2 on the dorsum of the foot is >40 mmHg; if it is <30 mmHg, it indicates insufficient peripheral blood supply, the foot is prone to ulcers, or existing ulcers are difficult to heal; if TcPO2 is <20 mmHg, there is almost no possibility of healing of foot ulcers.

paragraphs.paragraph_en: 4. Transcutaneous oxygen pressure (TcPO2): In normal people, TcPO2 on the dorsum of the foot is >40 mmHg; if it is <30 mmHg, it indicates insufficient peripheral blood supply, the foot is prone to ulcers, or existing ulcers are difficult to heal; if TcPO2 is <20 mmHg, there is almost no possibility of healing of foot ulcers.

sentences.sentence_en: (I) Diagnosis of diabetic lower limb vascular disease

paragraphs.paragraph_en: (I) Diagnosis of diabetic lower limb vascular disease

paragraphs.paragraph: 诊断依据：(1)符合糖尿病诊断；(2)具有下肢缺血的临床表现；(3)辅助检查提示下肢血管病变。静息时ABI<0.9，或静息时ABI>0.9，但运动时出现下肢不适症状，行踏车平板试验后ABI降低1 5%-20%或影像学提示血管存在狭窄。

sentences.sentence_en: Diagnostic basis: (1) meeting the diagnosis of diabetes; (2) having clinical manifestations of lower limb ischemia; (3) auxiliary examinations indicating lower limb vascular disease.

sentences.sentence_en: ABI < 0.9 at rest, or ABI > 0.9 at rest, but lower limb discomfort symptoms occur during exercise, ABI decreases by 15%-20% after the treadmill test, or imaging suggests vascular stenosis.

paragraphs.paragraph_en: 2. Diagnosis of diabetic peripheral neuropathy

paragraphs.paragraph: 明确的糖尿病病史；在诊断糖尿病时或之后出现的神经病变；临床症状和体征与DPN的表现相符；以下5项检查中如果有2项或2项以上异常则诊断为DPN：(1) 温度觉异常； (2) 尼龙丝检查，足部感觉减退或消失；(3)振动觉异常；(4)踝反射消失； (5) NCV有2项或2项以上减慢。

entities.entity_en: Decreased or absent sensation in the feet

sentences.sentence_en: A clear history of diabetes; neuropathy that develops at or after the diagnosis of diabetes; clinical symptoms and signs consistent with DPN; and DPN is diagnosed if two or more of the following five tests are abnormal: (1) abnormal temperature sensation; (2) decreased or absent foot sensation on nylon thread examination; (3) abnormal vibration sensation; (4) absent ankle reflexes; and (5) slowing of two or more NCV items.

paragraphs.paragraph_en: A clear history of diabetes; neuropathy that develops at or after the diagnosis of diabetes; clinical symptoms and signs consistent with DPN; and a diagnosis of DPN if two or more of the following five tests are abnormal: (1) abnormal temperature sensation; (2) decreased or absent foot sensation on nylon thread examination; (3) abnormal vibration sensation; (4) absent ankle reflexes; and (5) slowing of two or more NCV items.

paragraphs.paragraph: 排除其他病变如颈腰椎病变(神经根压迫、椎管狭窄、颈腰椎退行性变)、脑梗死、格林-巴利综合征、严重动静脉血管性病变(静脉栓塞、淋巴管炎)等，尚需鉴别药物尤其是化疗药物引起的神经毒性作用以及肾功能不全引起的代谢毒物对神经的损伤。

entities.entity_en: Degeneration of cervical and lumbar spine

sentences.sentence_en: Other diseases such as cervical and lumbar spine diseases (nerve root compression, spinal stenosis, cervical and lumbar degeneration), cerebral infarction, Guillain-Barré syndrome, severe arteriovenous vascular diseases (venous thrombosis, lymphangitis), etc. should be excluded. It is also necessary to identify the neurotoxic effects caused by drugs, especially chemotherapy drugs, and the damage to the nerves caused by metabolic toxins caused by renal insufficiency.

It is also necessary to identify the neurotoxic effects caused by drugs, especially chemotherapy drugs, and the damage to the nerves caused by metabolic toxins caused by renal insufficiency.

paragraphs.paragraph: 个别学者对DPN诊断进行分层，第1层指有DPN的症状或体征(踝反射、压力觉、振动觉、针刺觉、温度觉任意1项体征为阳性)，同时存在神经传导功能异常，可确诊；第2层指有DPN的症状及1项体征为阳性，或无症状但有2项及以上体征为阳性，可临床诊断；第3层指有DPN的症状但无体征或无症状但有1项体征阳性，为疑似诊断；第4层指无症状和体征，仅存在神经传导功能异常，为亚临床诊断。

sentences.sentence: 个别学者对DPN诊断进行分层，第1层指有DPN的症状或体征(踝反射、压力觉、振动觉、针刺觉、温度觉任意1项体征为阳性)，同时存在神经传导功能异常，可确诊；第2层指有DPN的症状及1项体征为阳性，或无症状但有2项及以上体征为阳性，可临床诊断；第3层指有DPN的症状但无体征或无症状但有1项体征阳性，为疑似诊断；第4层指无症状和体征，仅存在神经传导功能异常，为亚临床诊断。
sentences.sentence_en: Some scholars have stratified the diagnosis of DPN. The first level refers to the presence of symptoms or signs of DPN (any one of the signs of ankle reflex, pressure sensation, vibration sensation, pinprick sensation, and temperature sensation is positive) and abnormal nerve conduction function, which can be confirmed; the second level refers to the presence of symptoms of DPN and one positive sign, or no symptoms but two or more positive signs, which can be clinically diagnosed; the third level refers to the presence of symptoms of DPN but no signs, or no symptoms but one positive sign, which is a suspected diagnosis; the fourth level refers to the absence of symptoms and signs, and only abnormal nerve conduction function, which is a subclinical diagnosis.

paragraphs.paragraph_en: Some scholars have stratified the diagnosis of DPN. The first level refers to the presence of symptoms or signs of DPN (any one of the signs of ankle reflex, pressure sensation, vibration sensation, pinprick sensation, and temperature sensation is positive) and abnormal nerve conduction function, which can be confirmed; the second level refers to the presence of symptoms of DPN and one positive sign, or no symptoms but two or more positive signs, which can be clinically diagnosed; the third level refers to the presence of symptoms of DPN but no signs, or no symptoms but one positive sign, which is a suspected diagnosis; the fourth level refers to the absence of symptoms and signs, and only abnormal nerve conduction function, which is a subclinical diagnosis.

paragraphs.paragraph: (四)糖尿病足的分类、分级

sentences.sentence: (四)糖尿病足的分类、分级
sentences.sentence_en: 4. Classification and grading of diabetic foot

paragraphs.paragraph_en: 4. Classification and grading of diabetic foot

paragraphs.paragraph: 糖尿病足的表现为感染、溃疡和坏疽。溃疡依据病因可分为神经性、缺血性和混合性溃疡；坏疽的性质可分为湿性坏疽、干性坏疽和混合性坏疽3种类型。治疗前对糖尿病足患者进行正确的分类和分级，有助于选择合理的治疗方案和判断预后。

sentences.sentence: 糖尿病足的表现为感染、溃疡和坏疽。溃疡依据病因可分为神经性、缺血性和混合性溃疡；坏疽的性质可分为湿性坏疽、干性坏疽和混合性坏疽3种类型。
sentences.sentence_en: The manifestations of diabetic foot are infection, ulcers and gangrene. Ulcers can be divided into neuropathic, ischemic and mixed ulcers according to the cause; the nature of gangrene can be divided into three types: wet gangrene, dry gangrene and mixed gangrene.

sentences.sentence: 治疗前对糖尿病足患者进行正确的分类和分级，有助于选择合理的治疗方案和判断预后。
sentences.sentence_en: Correct classification and grading of diabetic foot patients before treatment will help choose a reasonable treatment plan and judge the prognosis.

paragraphs.paragraph_en: Diabetic foot symptoms include infection, ulcers, and gangrene. Ulcers can be divided into neuropathic, ischemic, and mixed ulcers based on their etiology; gangrene can be divided into three types: wet gangrene, dry gangrene, and mixed gangrene. Correct classification and grading of diabetic foot patients before treatment will help choose a reasonable treatment plan and determine the prognosis.

paragraphs.paragraph: 1.依据溃疡的病因进行分类

sentences.sentence: 1.依据溃疡的病因进行分类
sentences.sentence_en: 1. Classification based on the cause of ulcer

paragraphs.paragraph_en: 1. Classification based on the cause of ulcer

paragraphs.paragraph: (1)神经性溃疡：神经性溃疡患者通常有患足麻木、感觉异常、皮肤干燥，但皮温正常，足背动脉搏动良好。病情严重者可发展为神经性关节病 (Charcot关节病)。

sentences.sentence: (1)神经性溃疡：神经性溃疡患者通常有患足麻木、感觉异常、皮肤干燥，但皮温正常，足背动脉搏动良好。病情严重者可发展为神经性关节病 (Charcot关节病)。
sentences.sentence_en: (1) Neuropathic ulcers: Patients with neuropathic ulcers usually experience numbness, paresthesia, and dry skin in the affected foot, but their skin temperature is normal and the dorsalis pedis artery pulse is good. Severe cases may develop into neuropathic arthropathy (Charcot arthropathy).

paragraphs.paragraph_en: (1) Neuropathic ulcers: Patients with neuropathic ulcers usually experience numbness, paresthesia, and dry skin in the affected foot, but their skin temperature is normal and the dorsalis pedis artery pulse is good. Severe cases may develop into neuropathic arthropathy (Charcot arthropathy).

paragraphs.paragraph: (2)神经-缺血性溃疡：同时具有周围神经病变和周围血管病变，糖尿病足患者以此类居多。患者除了有神经性溃疡症状外还有下肢发凉感、间敏性跛行、静息痛等，足背动脉搏动减弱或消失，足部温减低，在进行清创换药时创面渗血少。

sentences.sentence: (2)神经-缺血性溃疡：同时具有周围神经病变和周围血管病变，糖尿病足患者以此类居多。患者除了有神经性溃疡症状外还有下肢发凉感、间敏性跛行、静息痛等，足背动脉搏动减弱或消失，足部温减低，在进行清创换药时创面渗血少。

entities.entity: 足背动脉搏动减弱或消失
entities.entity_en: The dorsalis pedis artery pulse is weakened or absent

sentences.sentence_en: (2) Neuro-ischemic ulcer: Patients with both peripheral neuropathy and peripheral vascular disease are mostly of this type. In addition to the symptoms of neuropathic ulcer, patients also have lower limb coldness, intermittent claudication, resting pain, etc., dorsalis pedis artery pulsation is weakened or absent, foot temperature is reduced, and there is less bleeding from the wound during debridement and dressing change.

paragraphs.paragraph_en: (2) Neuro-ischemic ulcer: Patients with both peripheral neuropathy and peripheral vascular disease are mostly of this type. In addition to the symptoms of neuropathic ulcer, patients also have lower limb coldness, intermittent claudication, resting pain, etc., dorsalis pedis artery pulsation is weakened or absent, foot temperature is reduced, and there is less bleeding from the wound during debridement and dressing change.

paragraphs.paragraph: (3)单纯缺血性溃疡：此类患者无周围神经病变，以缺血性改变为主，较少见，需根据症状、体征及相关检查排除周围神经病变后方可诊断。

sentences.sentence: (3)单纯缺血性溃疡：此类患者无周围神经病变，以缺血性改变为主，较少见，需根据症状、体征及相关检查排除周围神经病变后方可诊断。
sentences.sentence_en: (3) Simple ischemic ulcer: This type of patient does not have peripheral neuropathy, but mainly presents ischemic changes, which are relatively rare and can only be diagnosed after peripheral neuropathy is excluded based on symptoms, signs and related examinations.

paragraphs.paragraph_en: (3) Simple ischemic ulcer: This type of patient does not have peripheral neuropathy, but mainly presents ischemic changes. It is relatively rare and can only be diagnosed after peripheral neuropathy is excluded based on symptoms, signs and related examinations.

paragraphs.paragraph: 2.依据坏疽的性质分类

sentences.sentence: 2.依据坏疽的性质分类
sentences.sentence_en: 2. Classification based on the nature of gangrene

paragraphs.paragraph_en: 2. Classification based on the nature of gangrene

paragraphs.paragraph: (1)湿性坏疽：糖尿病湿性坏疽发病人数较多。多因肢端循环及微循环障碍，常伴周围神经病变和患足感染。局部常有红、肿、热、痛、功能障碍等，严重者常伴有毒血症或败血症等临床表现。

sentences.sentence: (1)湿性坏疽：糖尿病湿性坏疽发病人数较多。
sentences.sentence_en: (1) Wet gangrene: Diabetic wet gangrene is more common.

entities.entity: 肢端循环及微循环障碍

sentences.sentence_en: It is mostly caused by limb circulation and microcirculation disorders, often accompanied by peripheral neuropathy and foot infection.

sentences.sentence: 局部常有红、肿、热、痛、功能障碍等，严重者常伴有毒血症或败血症等临床表现。

entities.entity_en: Local redness, swelling, heat, pain, and dysfunction

sentences.sentence_en: Local symptoms include redness, swelling, heat, pain, and functional impairment. In severe cases, there are often clinical manifestations such as toxemia or sepsis.

paragraphs.paragraph_en: (1) Wet gangrene: Diabetic wet gangrene is common. It is usually caused by circulatory and microcirculatory disorders in the extremities, often accompanied by peripheral neuropathy and foot infection. Local symptoms include redness, swelling, heat, pain, and functional impairment. In severe cases, clinical manifestations include toxemia or sepsis.

paragraphs.paragraph: (2)干性坏疽：糖尿病干性坏疽发病人数较少，占糖尿病足坏疽的5.0%。多发生在糖尿病患者肢端动脉及小动脉粥样硬化，致管腔狭窄或闭塞，局部血供障碍，最终导致缺血组织发生干性坏疽。

sentences.sentence: (2)干性坏疽：糖尿病干性坏疽发病人数较少，占糖尿病足坏疽的5.0%。多发生在糖尿病患者肢端动脉及小动脉粥样硬化，致管腔狭窄或闭塞，局部血供障碍，最终导致缺血组织发生干性坏疽。
sentences.sentence_en: (2) Dry gangrene: The incidence of diabetic dry gangrene is relatively small, accounting for 5.0% of diabetic foot gangrene. It often occurs in diabetic patients with atherosclerosis of the extremities and arterioles, leading to stenosis or occlusion of the lumen, local blood supply obstruction, and ultimately leading to dry gangrene in ischemic tissues.

paragraphs.paragraph_en: (2) Dry gangrene: The incidence of diabetic dry gangrene is relatively small, accounting for 5.0% of diabetic foot gangrene. It often occurs in diabetic patients with atherosclerosis of the extremities and arterioles, leading to stenosis or occlusion of the lumen, local blood supply obstruction, and ultimately leading to dry gangrene in ischemic tissues.

paragraphs.paragraph: (3)混合性坏疽：混合性坏疽较干性坏疽稍多见，占糖尿病足坏疽的15.2%。肢端局部血供障碍引起干性坏疽，而病变另一部分合并感染。

sentences.sentence: (3)混合性坏疽：混合性坏疽较干性坏疽稍多见，占糖尿病足坏疽的15.2%。肢端局部血供障碍引起干性坏疽，而病变另一部分合并感染。

entities.entity_en: Local blood supply disorder of extremities

sentences.sentence_en: (3) Mixed gangrene: Mixed gangrene is slightly more common than dry gangrene, accounting for 15.2% of diabetic foot gangrene. Dry gangrene is caused by local blood supply obstruction in the extremities, while another part of the lesion is infected.

paragraphs.paragraph_en: (3) Mixed gangrene: Mixed gangrene is slightly more common than dry gangrene, accounting for 15.2% of diabetic foot gangrene. Dry gangrene is caused by local blood supply obstruction in the extremities, while another part of the lesion is infected.

paragraphs.paragraph: 3.糖尿病足的分级

sentences.sentence: 3.糖尿病足的分级
sentences.sentence_en: 3. Grading of diabetic foot

paragraphs.paragraph_en: 3. Grading of diabetic foot

paragraphs.paragraph: 依据不同的病变程度需要对糖尿病足进行分级，目前临床上广为接受的分级方法主要有Wagner 分级、Texas分级，但因为糖尿病足病情复杂，血管病变、神经病变、感染的程度、软组织及骨质破坏情况等差异大，所以任何一种分级方法都不可能做到十全十美。

sentences.sentence: 依据不同的病变程度需要对糖尿病足进行分级，目前临床上广为接受的分级方法主要有Wagner 分级、Texas分级，但因为糖尿病足病情复杂，血管病变、神经病变、感染的程度、软组织及骨质破坏情况等差异大，所以任何一种分级方法都不可能做到十全十美。
sentences.sentence_en: Diabetic foot needs to be graded according to the different degrees of lesions. Currently, the widely accepted grading methods in clinical practice are Wagner grade and Texas grade. However, due to the complexity of diabetic foot, there are great differences in vascular lesions, neuropathy, degree of infection, soft tissue and bone destruction, so no grading method can be perfect.

paragraphs.paragraph_en: Diabetic foot needs to be graded according to the different degrees of lesions. Currently, the widely accepted grading methods in clinical practice are Wagner grade and Texas grade. However, due to the complexity of diabetic foot, there are great differences in vascular lesions, neuropathy, degree of infection, soft tissue and bone destruction, so no grading method can be perfect.

paragraphs.paragraph: (1) Wagner分级：此分级方法首先由Meggitt于1976年提出，Wagner后来加以推广，是目前临床及科研中应用最为广泛的分级方法(表2)。

sentences.sentence: (1) Wagner分级：此分级方法首先由Meggitt于1976年提出，Wagner后来加以推广，是目前临床及科研中应用最为广泛的分级方法(表2)。
sentences.sentence_en: (1) Wagner classification: This classification method was first proposed by Meggitt in 1976 and later promoted by Wagner. It is currently the most widely used classification method in clinical and scientific research (Table 2).

paragraphs.paragraph_en: (1) Wagner classification: This classification method was first proposed by Meggitt in 1976 and later promoted by Wagner. It is currently the most widely used classification method in clinical and scientific research (Table 2).

paragraphs.paragraph: (2) Texas分级法：Texas分级法是由美国Texas San Antonio大学Lavery等提出的(表3) ，此分级方法从病变程度和病因两个方面对糖尿病足溃疡及坏疽进行评估，更好地体现了创面感染和缺血的情况，相对于Wagner分级在评价创面的严重性和预测肢体预后情况上更好。

sentences.sentence: (2) Texas分级法：Texas分级法是由美国Texas San Antonio大学Lavery等提出的(表3) ，此分级方法从病变程度和病因两个方面对糖尿病足溃疡及坏疽进行评估，更好地体现了创面感染和缺血的情况，相对于Wagner分级在评价创面的严重性和预测肢体预后情况上更好。
sentences.sentence_en: (2) Texas grading: The Texas grading was proposed by Lavery et al. from the University of Texas San Antonio (Table 3). This grading method evaluates diabetic foot ulcers and gangrene from the two aspects of lesion severity and etiology, better reflecting the infection and ischemia of the wound surface. Compared with the Wagner grading, it is better in evaluating the severity of the wound surface and predicting the prognosis of the limb.

paragraphs.paragraph_en: (2) Texas grading: The Texas grading was proposed by Lavery et al. from the University of Texas San Antonio (Table 3). This grading method evaluates diabetic foot ulcers and gangrene from the two aspects of lesion severity and etiology, better reflecting the infection and ischemia of the wound surface. Compared with the Wagner grading, it is better in evaluating the severity of the wound surface and predicting the prognosis of the limb.

paragraphs.paragraph: (3)空军总医院分级法：空军总医院内分泌科李仕明主任依据机体组织抗感染能力及坏疽病变的性质、范围、深度作为分级的依据和说明感染严重程度的依据，结合国内外分级标准，将糖尿病足按病变程度划分为0~5级，提出了空军总医院糖尿病足分级方法。

sentences.sentence: (3)空军总医院分级法：空军总医院内分泌科李仕明主任依据机体组织抗感染能力及坏疽病变的性质、范围、深度作为分级的依据和说明感染严重程度的依据，结合国内外分级标准，将糖尿病足按病变程度划分为0~5级，提出了空军总医院糖尿病足分级方法。
sentences.sentence_en: (3) Air Force General Hospital Grading Method: Director Li Shiming of the Endocrinology Department of the Air Force General Hospital uses the body's tissue resistance to infection and the nature, scope, and depth of gangrenous lesions as the basis for grading and explaining the severity of infection. In combination with domestic and international grading standards, he divides diabetic foot into grades 0 to 5 according to the severity of the lesions and proposed the Air Force General Hospital's diabetic foot grading method.

paragraphs.paragraph: (一)? 糖尿病足的治疗目标及治疗策略

sentences.sentence: (一)? 糖尿病足的治疗目标及治疗策略
sentences.sentence_en: (I) Treatment goals and strategies for diabetic foot

paragraphs.paragraph_en: (I) Treatment goals and strategies for diabetic foot

paragraphs.paragraph: 糖尿病足的治疗目标：预防全身动脉粥样硬化疾病的进展，预防心、脑血管事件的发生，降低糖尿病足患者死亡率；预防缺血导致的溃疡和肢端坏疽，预防截肢或降低截肢平面，改善间歇性跛行患者的下肢肤体功能状态。

sentences.sentence: 糖尿病足的治疗目标：预防全身动脉粥样硬化疾病的进展，预防心、脑血管事件的发生，降低糖尿病足患者死亡率；预防缺血导致的溃疡和肢端坏疽，预防截肢或降低截肢平面，改善间歇性跛行患者的下肢肤体功能状态。

entities.entity: 全身动脉粥样硬化疾病

sentences.sentence_en: The treatment goals of diabetic foot are: to prevent the progression of systemic atherosclerotic diseases, prevent the occurrence of cardiovascular and cerebrovascular events, and reduce the mortality rate of patients with diabetic foot; to prevent ulcers and extremity gangrene caused by ischemia, prevent amputation or reduce the amputation plane, and improve the lower limb skin function status of patients with intermittent claudication.

paragraphs.paragraph_en: The treatment goals of diabetic foot are: to prevent the progression of systemic atherosclerotic diseases, prevent the occurrence of cardiovascular and cerebrovascular events, and reduce the mortality rate of patients with diabetic foot; to prevent ulcers and extremity gangrene caused by ischemia, prevent amputation or reduce the amputation plane, and improve the lower limb skin function status of patients with intermittent claudication.

paragraphs.paragraph: 糖尿病足的治疗策略：一级预防——防止或延缓神经病变、周围血管病变的发生；二级预防——缓解症状，延缓神经病变、周围血管病变的进展；三级预防——血运重建，溃疡综合治疗，降低截肢率和心血管事件发生率。

sentences.sentence: 糖尿病足的治疗策略：一级预防——防止或延缓神经病变、周围血管病变的发生；二级预防——缓解症状，延缓神经病变、周围血管病变的进展；三级预防——血运重建，溃疡综合治疗，降低截肢率和心血管事件发生率。
sentences.sentence_en: Treatment strategies for diabetic foot: Primary prevention - prevent or delay the occurrence of neuropathy and peripheral vascular disease; secondary prevention - relieve symptoms and delay the progression of neuropathy and peripheral vascular disease; tertiary prevention - revascularization, comprehensive treatment of ulcers, and reduce the amputation rate and the incidence of cardiovascular events.

paragraphs.paragraph_en: Treatment strategies for diabetic foot: Primary prevention - prevent or delay the occurrence of neuropathy and peripheral vascular disease; secondary prevention - relieve symptoms and delay the progression of neuropathy and peripheral vascular disease; tertiary prevention - revascularization, comprehensive treatment of ulcers, and reduction of amputation rate and incidence of cardiovascular events.

paragraphs.paragraph: (二)糖尿病足的内科治疗

sentences.sentence: (二)糖尿病足的内科治疗
sentences.sentence_en: 2. Medical treatment of diabetic foot

paragraphs.paragraph_en: 2. Medical treatment of diabetic foot

paragraphs.paragraph: 在糖尿病足的药物治疗中，要重视综合治疗。糖尿病足常分为3种类型，即神经型、缺血型和神经缺血型(也叫混合型)。研究发现，我国糖尿病足以混合型为主，其次为缺血型，而单纯神经型比较少见。对于神经病变型，目前除治疗神经病变外，重要的是患肢减压，局部清创可促进溃疡愈合；而对于缺血型病变则可以通过药物治疗，运动锻炼和重建下肢血流的方法，取得一定疗效；即使混合型病变，如果血流得到改善，其神经病变也可得到部分缓解。

sentences.sentence: 在糖尿病足的药物治疗中，要重视综合治疗。糖尿病足常分为3种类型，即神经型、缺血型和神经缺血型(也叫混合型)。研究发现，我国糖尿病足以混合型为主，其次为缺血型，而单纯神经型比较少见。

entities.entity: 神经缺血型(也叫混合型)

sentences.sentence_en: In the drug treatment of diabetic foot, it is important to pay attention to comprehensive treatment. Diabetic foot is often divided into three types, namely neuropathic, ischemic and neuroischemic (also called mixed). Studies have found that in my country, the main type of diabetic foot is mixed, followed by ischemic, while pure neuropathic is relatively rare.

sentences.sentence: 对于神经病变型，目前除治疗神经病变外，重要的是患肢减压，局部清创可促进溃疡愈合；而对于缺血型病变则可以通过药物治疗，运动锻炼和重建下肢血流的方法，取得一定疗效；即使混合型病变，如果血流得到改善，其神经病变也可得到部分缓解。

entities.entity_en: Restoring blood flow to the lower extremities

sentences.sentence_en: For the neuropathy type, in addition to treating the neuropathy, it is important to decompress the affected limb, and local debridement can promote ulcer healing; for ischemic lesions, certain therapeutic effects can be achieved through drug treatment, exercise and reconstruction of lower limb blood flow; even for mixed lesions, if blood flow is improved, the neuropathy can be partially relieved.

paragraphs.paragraph_en: In the drug treatment of diabetic foot, it is important to pay attention to comprehensive treatment. Diabetic foot is often divided into three types, namely neuropathic, ischemic and neuroischemic (also called mixed). Studies have found that the diabetic foot in my country is mainly mixed, followed by ischemic, and pure neuropathic is relatively rare. For the neuropathy type, in addition to treating neuropathy, it is important to decompress the affected limb, and local debridement can promote ulcer healing; for ischemic lesions, certain therapeutic effects can be achieved through drug treatment, exercise and reconstruction of lower limb blood flow; even for mixed lesions, if blood flow is improved, the neuropathy can be partially relieved.

paragraphs.paragraph: 1.良好的代谢管理：对于糖尿病足患者，应积极进行血糖控制，首选胰岛素控制血糖，同时对患者进行充分地血糖控制[糖化血红蛋白 (HbA1c)<7%] ，同时尽可能减少低血糖的发生以降低足溃疡和感染的发生率，继而降低患者的截肢风险。但由于糖尿病足患者常常年龄较大，合并症及并发症较多，因此不能一味地强调将患者的H bA1c控制在7%以下，此时应该参照中华医学会内分泌学分会制定的《中国成人2型糖尿病HbA1c控制目标的专家共识》推荐的个体化控制目标.

sentences.sentence: 1.良好的代谢管理：对于糖尿病足患者，应积极进行血糖控制，首选胰岛素控制血糖，同时对患者进行充分地血糖控制[糖化血红蛋白 (HbA1c)<7%] ，同时尽可能减少低血糖的发生以降低足溃疡和感染的发生率，继而降低患者的截肢风险。但由于糖尿病足患者常常年龄较大，合并症及并发症较多，因此不能一味地强调将患者的H bA1c控制在7%以下，此时应该参照中华医学会内分泌学分会制定的《中国成人2型糖尿病HbA1c控制目标的专家共识》推荐的个体化控制目标.
sentences.sentence_en: 1. Good metabolic management: For patients with diabetic foot, blood sugar control should be actively carried out, and insulin should be used first to control blood sugar. At the same time, patients should be fully controlled for blood sugar [glycosylated hemoglobin (HbA1c) <7%], and the occurrence of hypoglycemia should be reduced as much as possible to reduce the incidence of foot ulcers and infections, and then reduce the risk of amputation. However, since patients with diabetic foot are often older and have more comorbidities and complications, it is not advisable to blindly emphasize that the patient's HbA1c should be controlled below 7%. At this time, the individualized control target recommended by the "Expert Consensus on HbA1c Control Targets for Chinese Adults with Type 2 Diabetes" formulated by the Endocrinology Branch of the Chinese Medical Association should be referred to.

paragraphs.paragraph_en: 1. Good metabolic management: For patients with diabetic foot, blood sugar control should be actively carried out, and insulin should be used first to control blood sugar. At the same time, patients should be fully controlled for blood sugar [glycosylated hemoglobin (HbA1c) <7%], and the occurrence of hypoglycemia should be reduced as much as possible to reduce the incidence of foot ulcers and infections, and then reduce the risk of amputation. However, since patients with diabetic foot are often older and have more comorbidities and complications, it is not advisable to blindly emphasize that the patient's HbA1c should be controlled below 7%. At this time, the individualized control target recommended by the "Expert Consensus on HbA1c Control Targets for Chinese Adults with Type 2 Diabetes" formulated by the Endocrinology Branch of the Chinese Medical Association should be referred to.

paragraphs.paragraph: 对于糖尿病足合并高血压者，应将血压控制在140/85mmHg以下；糖尿病足合并脂代谢患者，应给予他汀类药物治疗，将低密度脂蛋白胆固醇水平控制在2.1mmol/L以下，若患者同时合并下肢动脉病变，则应将低密度脂蛋白胆固醇水平控制在1 .7mmol/L以下；若无临床禁忌，应该给予小剂量阿司匹林(75~150mg/d)。

sentences.sentence: 对于糖尿病足合并高血压者，应将血压控制在140/85mmHg以下；糖尿病足合并脂代谢患者，应给予他汀类药物治疗，将低密度脂蛋白胆固醇水平控制在2.1mmol/L以下，若患者同时合并下肢动脉病变，则应将低密度脂蛋白胆固醇水平控制在1 .7mmol/L以下；若无临床禁忌，应该给予小剂量阿司匹林(75~150mg/d)。

sentences.sentence_en: For patients with diabetic foot and hypertension, blood pressure should be controlled below 140/85 mmHg; patients with diabetic foot and lipid metabolism should be given statins to control low-density lipoprotein cholesterol levels below 2.1 mmol/L. If the patient also has lower limb arterial disease, the low-density lipoprotein cholesterol level should be controlled below 1.7 mmol/L; if there are no clinical contraindications, low-dose aspirin (75-150 mg/d) should be given.

paragraphs.paragraph_en: For patients with diabetic foot and hypertension, blood pressure should be controlled below 140/85 mmHg; patients with diabetic foot and lipid metabolism should be given statins to control low-density lipoprotein cholesterol levels below 2.1 mmol/L. If the patient also has lower limb arterial disease, the low-density lipoprotein cholesterol level should be controlled below 1.7 mmol/L; if there are no clinical contraindications, low-dose aspirin (75-150 mg/d) should be given.

paragraphs.paragraph: 2.下肢运动康复治疗：对于足部皮肤完整的缺血型或神经缺血型患者，运动锻炼能改善间歇性跛行患者的步行距离及行走时间。与安慰剂或常规护理相比较，监督下的运动康复锻炼可显著提高下肢动脉病变患者的最大步行距离[加权均数差 (WMD) =218.01m，95%CI：161.54~274.48m，P<0.00001] 、无痛行走距离(WMD=174.19m，95%CI：130.25~218.13m，P<0.00001) 、6min 步行距离(WMD=42.91m，95%CI：25.41~ 59.41m，P<0.00001)。同时还可以显著提高下肢动脉病变患者的运动功能指标，如行走受损问卷(WIQ) 距离评分、WIQ速度评分、WIQ爬梯评分。提示强化步行运动可以提高足部皮肤完整的缺血型或神经缺血型患者的运动耐受性，改善运动功能，且不增加不良事件的发生，是一种安全有效的治疗方式。

sentences.sentence: 2.下肢运动康复治疗：对于足部皮肤完整的缺血型或神经缺血型患者，运动锻炼能改善间歇性跛行患者的步行距离及行走时间。与安慰剂或常规护理相比较，监督下的运动康复锻炼可显著提高下肢动脉病变患者的最大步行距离[加权均数差 (WMD) =218.01m，95%CI：161.54~274.48m，P<0.00001] 、无痛行走距离(WMD=174.19m，95%CI：130.25~218.13m，P<0.00001) 、6min 步行距离(WMD=42.91m，95%CI：25.41~ 59.41m，P<0.00001)。
sentences.sentence_en: 2. Lower limb exercise rehabilitation therapy: For patients with ischemic or neuroischemic foot skin intact, exercise training can improve the walking distance and walking time of patients with intermittent claudication. Compared with placebo or routine care, supervised exercise rehabilitation training can significantly improve the maximum walking distance [weighted mean difference (WMD) = 218.01m, 95%CI: 161.54~274.48m, P<0.00001], pain-free walking distance (WMD=174.19m, 95%CI: 130.25~218.13m, P<0.00001), and 6-minute walking distance (WMD=42.91m, 95%CI: 25.41~ 59.41m, P<0.00001) in patients with lower limb arterial disease.

sentences.sentence: 同时还可以显著提高下肢动脉病变患者的运动功能指标，如行走受损问卷(WIQ) 距离评分、WIQ速度评分、WIQ爬梯评分。
sentences.sentence_en: At the same time, it can also significantly improve the motor function indicators of patients with lower limb arterial lesions, such as the Walking Impairment Questionnaire (WIQ) distance score, WIQ speed score, and WIQ ladder climbing score.

sentences.sentence: 提示强化步行运动可以提高足部皮肤完整的缺血型或神经缺血型患者的运动耐受性，改善运动功能，且不增加不良事件的发生，是一种安全有效的治疗方式。
sentences.sentence_en: These results suggest that enhanced walking exercise can improve exercise tolerance and motor function in patients with ischemic or neuroischemic foot skin intact without increasing the occurrence of adverse events, and is a safe and effective treatment method.

paragraphs.paragraph_en: 2. Lower limb exercise rehabilitation therapy: For patients with intact foot skin ischemia or neuroischemia, exercise training can improve the walking distance and walking time of patients with intermittent claudication. Compared with placebo or routine care, supervised exercise rehabilitation training can significantly improve the maximum walking distance of patients with lower limb arterial disease [weighted mean difference (WMD) = 218.01m, 95%CI: 161.54~274.48m, P<0.00001], pain-free walking distance (WMD=174.19m, 95%CI: 130.25~218.13m, P<0.00001), and 6-minute walking distance (WMD=42.91m, 95%CI: 25.41~ 59.41m, P<0.00001). At the same time, it can also significantly improve the motor function indicators of patients with lower limb arterial disease, such as the walking impairment questionnaire (WIQ) distance score, WIQ speed score, and WIQ ladder score. These results suggest that enhanced walking exercise can improve exercise tolerance and motor function in patients with ischemic or neuroischemic foot skin intact without increasing the occurrence of adverse events, and is a safe and effective treatment method.

paragraphs.paragraph: 盐酸沙格雷酯是一种多靶点循环改善剂，对血小板以及血管平滑肌的5-羟色胺(5-HT)2受体具有特异性拮抗作用，从而抑制5-HT2导致的血小板凝聚，抑制血管收缩和平滑肌细胞增殖；改善红细胞的变形能力，改善侧支循环及微循环障碍。

sentences.sentence: 盐酸沙格雷酯是一种多靶点循环改善剂，对血小板以及血管平滑肌的5-羟色胺(5-HT)2受体具有特异性拮抗作用，从而抑制5-HT2导致的血小板凝聚，抑制血管收缩和平滑肌细胞增殖；改善红细胞的变形能力，改善侧支循环及微循环障碍。
sentences.sentence_en: Sarpogrelate hydrochloride is a multi-target circulation improver that has a specific antagonistic effect on the 5-hydroxytryptamine (5-HT) 2 receptors of platelets and vascular smooth muscle, thereby inhibiting platelet aggregation caused by 5-HT2, inhibiting vasoconstriction and smooth muscle cell proliferation; improving the deformability of red blood cells, and improving collateral circulation and microcirculation disorders.

paragraphs.paragraph_en: Sarpogrelate hydrochloride is a multi-target circulation improver that has a specific antagonistic effect on the 5-hydroxytryptamine (5-HT) 2 receptors of platelets and vascular smooth muscle, thereby inhibiting platelet aggregation caused by 5-HT2, inhibiting vasoconstriction and smooth muscle cell proliferation; improving the deformability of red blood cells, and improving collateral circulation and microcirculation disorders.

paragraphs.paragraph: 一项系统评价纳入了9个RCT研究，荟萃分析结果显示，盐酸沙格雷酯治疗下肢血管病变，能减小患者溃疡面积，增加ABI、足背动脉血流量，无痛行走距离增加200.87m。一项RCT研究显示，盐酸沙格雷酯治疗糖尿病下肢血管病变，能有效增加患者最大行走距离和无痛行走距离，部分改善足背动脉和胫后动脉的流速、阻力指数和ABI指标。因此，盐酸沙格雷酯被推荐治疗慢性动脉闭塞症所引起的溃疡、疼痛以及冷感等缺血性诸症状，尤其对静息痛的疗效显著。盐酸沙格雷酯的推荐剂量为100mg/次，2次/d。

sentences.sentence_en: A systematic review included 9 RCT studies. The meta-analysis results showed that sarpogrelate hydrochloride can reduce the ulcer area, increase ABI and dorsalis pedis artery blood flow, and increase the pain-free walking distance by 200.87m in the treatment of lower limb vascular disease. An RCT study showed that sarpogrelate hydrochloride can effectively increase the maximum walking distance and pain-free walking distance of patients in the treatment of diabetic lower limb vascular disease, and partially improve the flow velocity, resistance index and ABI index of the dorsalis pedis artery and posterior tibial artery. Therefore, sarpogrelate hydrochloride is recommended for the treatment of ischemic symptoms such as ulcers, pain and cold sensation caused by chronic arterial occlusive disease, especially for rest pain. The recommended dose of sarpogrelate hydrochloride is 100 mg/time, 2 times/d.

paragraphs.paragraph_en: A systematic review included 9 RCT studies. The meta-analysis results showed that sarpogrelate hydrochloride can reduce the ulcer area, increase ABI and dorsalis pedis artery blood flow, and increase the pain-free walking distance by 200.87m in the treatment of lower limb vascular disease. An RCT study showed that sarpogrelate hydrochloride can effectively increase the maximum walking distance and pain-free walking distance of patients in the treatment of diabetic lower limb vascular disease, and partially improve the flow velocity, resistance index and ABI index of the dorsalis pedis artery and posterior tibial artery. Therefore, sarpogrelate hydrochloride is recommended for the treatment of ischemic symptoms such as ulcers, pain and cold sensation caused by chronic arterial occlusive disease, especially for rest pain. The recommended dose of sarpogrelate hydrochloride is 100 mg/time, 2 times/d.

paragraphs.paragraph: 在前列腺素类药物中，脂微球前列地尔注射液的疗效和耐受性最好。荟萃分析表明，与安慰剂相比，前列腺素El(PGE I) 能够显著增加步行距离，即使停止治疗后其步行能力仍然保持增加。脂微球前列地尔注射液的剂量根据患者病变程度推荐为10μg/次，1~2次/d，静脉推注或滴注，疗程14~ 21d。贝前列素钠治疗能改善糖尿病性周围血管病变患者下肢的主观症状，如烧灼样感觉、冷感觉、水肿、劳力性疼痛、针刺样疼痛及感觉异常。与安慰剂相比，每日口服贝前列素钠40μg，3次/d，治疗6个月，无痛性行走距离改善超过50%的LEAD患者在两组分别为43.5%与33.3%，两组间无痛性行走距离分别增加81.5%和52.5%，最大步行距离分别增加60.1%和35.0%，严重心血管事件的发生率分别为4.8%和8.9%。因此，贝前列素钠能有效地改善间歇性行患者的症状。贝前列腺素钠的剂量根据患者病变程度推荐为20~40μg/次，2~ 3次/d。

sentences.sentence_en: Meta-analysis showed that compared with placebo, prostaglandin El (PGE I) can significantly increase walking distance, and even after stopping treatment, the walking ability remains increased. The dose of lipomicrosphere alprostadil injection is recommended to be 10 μg/time, 1~2 times/d, intravenous push or drip, and the course of treatment is 14~21d according to the degree of the patient's lesion. Beraprost sodium treatment can improve the subjective symptoms of lower limbs in patients with diabetic peripheral vascular disease, such as burning sensation, cold sensation, edema, exertional pain, needle-like pain and paresthesia. Compared with placebo, daily oral beraprost sodium 40 μg, 3 times/d, for 6 months, the pain-free walking distance of LEAD patients improved by more than 50% in 43.5% and 33.3% of the two groups, the pain-free walking distance increased by 81.5% and 52.5% respectively, the maximum walking distance increased by 60.1% and 35.0% respectively, and the incidence of serious cardiovascular events was 4.8% and 8.9% respectively.

sentences.sentence: 因此，贝前列素钠能有效地改善间歇性行患者的症状。

sentences.sentence_en: The recommended dose of beta-prostaglandin sodium is 20~40μg/time, 2~3 times/day, depending on the severity of the patient's lesions.

paragraphs.paragraph_en: Among prostaglandins, lipomicrosphere alprostadil injection has the best efficacy and tolerability. Meta-analysis shows that compared with placebo, prostaglandin El (PGE I) can significantly increase walking distance, and its walking ability remains increased even after treatment is stopped. The dose of lipomicrosphere alprostadil injection is recommended to be 10μg/time, 1~2 times/d, intravenous push or drip, and the course of treatment is 14~21d according to the degree of patient lesions. Beraprost sodium treatment can improve the subjective symptoms of lower limbs in patients with diabetic peripheral vascular disease, such as burning sensation, cold sensation, edema, exertional pain, pin-like pain and paresthesia. Compared with placebo, daily oral administration of beraprost sodium 40 μg, 3 times/d, for 6 months, the pain-free walking distance of LEAD patients improved by more than 50% in 43.5% and 33.3% of the two groups, respectively. The pain-free walking distance increased by 81.5% and 52.5% between the two groups, respectively. The maximum walking distance increased by 60.1% and 35.0%, respectively. The incidence of serious cardiovascular events was 4.8% and 8.9%, respectively. Therefore, beraprost sodium can effectively improve the symptoms of patients with intermittent walking. The recommended dose of beraprost sodium is 20~40μg/time, 2~3 times/d according to the degree of the patient's lesion.

paragraphs.paragraph: (2)抗血小板药物治疗：在糖尿病足患者，氯吡格雷是有适应证的抗血小板药物，与阿司匹林相比，氯吡格雷联合阿司匹林的抗血小板治疗能显著降低其全因死亡率(RR=0.73，95%CI：0.58~0.93)和心血管事件(RR=0.81，95%CI：0.67~0.98)发生，但严重出血的风险轻度增加。此外，氯吡格雷联合阿司匹林的双联抗血小板治疗能显著降低下肢血管重建术后的大截肢事件[与单纯的阿司匹林治疗相比，RR=0.68，95%CI：0.46~0.99，需治疗人数(NNT)=94]。因此，目前推荐氯吡格雷为对阿司匹林不耐受或对阿司匹林过敏的患者的另一种治疗选择。

sentences.sentence_en: (2) Antiplatelet drug therapy: Clopidogrel is an indicated antiplatelet drug for patients with diabetic foot. Compared with aspirin, antiplatelet therapy with clopidogrel combined with aspirin can significantly reduce all-cause mortality (RR=0.73, 95%CI: 0.58~0.93) and cardiovascular events (RR=0.81, 95%CI: 0.67~0.98), but the risk of severe bleeding is slightly increased.

sentences.sentence: 此外，氯吡格雷联合阿司匹林的双联抗血小板治疗能显著降低下肢血管重建术后的大截肢事件[与单纯的阿司匹林治疗相比，RR=0.68，95%CI：0.46~0.99，需治疗人数(NNT)=94]。
sentences.sentence_en: In addition, dual antiplatelet therapy with clopidogrel combined with aspirin can significantly reduce major amputation events after lower limb revascularization [compared with aspirin treatment alone, RR=0.68, 95%CI: 0.46~0.99, number needed to treat (NNT)=94].

sentences.sentence: 因此，目前推荐氯吡格雷为对阿司匹林不耐受或对阿司匹林过敏的患者的另一种治疗选择。
sentences.sentence_en: Therefore, clopidogrel is currently recommended as an alternative treatment option for patients who are intolerant to or allergic to aspirin.

paragraphs.paragraph_en: (2) Antiplatelet therapy: Clopidogrel is an indicated antiplatelet drug for patients with diabetic foot. Compared with aspirin, antiplatelet therapy with clopidogrel combined with aspirin can significantly reduce all-cause mortality (RR=0.73, 95%CI: 0.58~0.93) and cardiovascular events (RR=0.81, 95%CI: 0.67~0.98), but the risk of severe bleeding is slightly increased. In addition, dual antiplatelet therapy with clopidogrel combined with aspirin can significantly reduce major amputation events after lower limb revascularization [compared with aspirin alone, RR=0.68, 95%CI: 0.46~0.99, number needed to treat (NNT)=94]. Therefore, clopidogrel is currently recommended as another treatment option for patients who are intolerant to or allergic to aspirin.

paragraphs.paragraph: 此外，在行血管旁路手术的糖尿病足患者，阿司匹林或阿司匹林联合双密达莫(ASA/DIP)治疗能显著改善移植人工血管的血管通畅率(OR=0.42，95%C：0.22~0.83，P=0.01)。但在自体静脉移植血管中任何时间点均未发现这种效果，而在人造血管移植中的各个时间点都能发现这种益处，包括在移植12个月后(OR=0.19，95%CI：0.10~0.36，P<0.00001)。阿司匹林联合氯毗格雷与阿司匹林比较，所有血管移植物的通畅率在24个月时均无明显差异，组间的截肢或死亡发生率差异无统计学意义，而阿司匹林联合氯吡格雷虽然不增加大出血或致死性出血风险，但增加总的出血风险(OR=2.65，95%CI：1.69~4.15)，包括轻度出血(OR=2.34，95%CI：1.37~4.00)和中度出血(OR=4.13，95%CI：1.37~12.45)。

sentences.sentence: 此外，在行血管旁路手术的糖尿病足患者，阿司匹林或阿司匹林联合双密达莫(ASA/DIP)治疗能显著改善移植人工血管的血管通畅率(OR=0.42，95%C：0.22~0.83，P=0.01)。但在自体静脉移植血管中任何时间点均未发现这种效果，而在人造血管移植中的各个时间点都能发现这种益处，包括在移植12个月后(OR=0.19，95%CI：0.10~0.36，P<0.00001)。阿司匹林联合氯毗格雷与阿司匹林比较，所有血管移植物的通畅率在24个月时均无明显差异，组间的截肢或死亡发生率差异无统计学意义，而阿司匹林联合氯吡格雷虽然不增加大出血或致死性出血风险，但增加总的出血风险(OR=2.65，95%CI：1.69~4.15)，包括轻度出血(OR=2.34，95%CI：1.37~4.00)和中度出血(OR=4.13，95%CI：1.37~12.45)。
sentences.sentence_en: In addition, in patients with diabetic foot undergoing vascular bypass surgery, aspirin or aspirin combined with dipyridamole (ASA/DIP) treatment can significantly improve the vascular patency of grafted artificial blood vessels (OR=0.42, 95%C: 0.22-0.83, P=0.01). However, this effect was not found at any time point in autologous vein grafts, while this benefit was found at all time points in artificial blood vessel grafts, including 12 months after transplantation (OR=0.19, 95%CI: 0.10-0.36, P<0.00001). Compared with aspirin alone, there was no significant difference in the patency rate of all vascular grafts at 24 months in the combination of aspirin combined with clopidogrel, and there was no statistically significant difference in the incidence of amputation or death between the two groups. Although aspirin combined with clopidogrel did not increase the risk of major or fatal bleeding, it increased the overall bleeding risk (OR=2.65, 95%CI: 1.69~4.15), including mild bleeding (OR=2.34, 95%CI: 1.37~4.00) and moderate bleeding (OR=4.13, 95%CI: 1.37~12.45).

paragraphs.paragraph_en: In addition, in patients with diabetic foot undergoing vascular bypass surgery, aspirin or aspirin combined with dipyridamole (ASA/DIP) treatment can significantly improve the vascular patency of grafted artificial blood vessels (OR=0.42, 95%C: 0.22-0.83, P=0.01). However, this effect was not found at any time point in autologous vein grafts, while this benefit was found at all time points in artificial blood vessel grafts, including 12 months after transplantation (OR=0.19, 95%CI: 0.10-0.36, P<0.00001). Compared with aspirin alone, there was no significant difference in the patency rate of all vascular grafts at 24 months in the combination of aspirin combined with clopidogrel, and there was no statistically significant difference in the incidence of amputation or death between the two groups. Although aspirin combined with clopidogrel did not increase the risk of major or fatal bleeding, it increased the overall bleeding risk (OR=2.65, 95%CI: 1.69~4.15), including mild bleeding (OR=2.34, 95%CI: 1.37~4.00) and moderate bleeding (OR=4.13, 95%CI: 1.37~12.45).

paragraphs.paragraph: (3)抗凝血药物(肝素、低分子肝素及口服抗凝血药物)：月前没有明确的证据支持在糖尿病足前期的间歇性跛行阶段应用抗凝血治疗。与单用阿司匹林相比，在严重肢体缺血患者，低分子肝素联合阿司匹林能显著降低血管腔内微创治疗(球囊扩张及支架植入)的糖尿病足患者的血管闭塞/再狭窄(高达85%)(OR=0.15，95%CI：0.06~0.42，P=0.0003)；而巴曲酶联合阿司匹林显著降低糖尿病患者的再狭窄(OR=0.28，95%Cl：0.13~0.60)，不伴出血和其他消化道不良事件的显著增加。在急性肢体缺血的初期治疗中，起始手术或者溶栓治疗对于30d、6个月或1年的保肢或死亡发生，两者差异无统计学意义；但起始溶栓治疗组(1.3%)30d的卒中发生率较起始手术治疗组(0%)显著增加(OR=6.41，95%CI：1.57~26.22)；30d的大出血发生率分别为8.8%与3.3%(OR=2.80，95%CI：1.70~4.60)，病灶远端的栓塞发生率分别为12.4%与0%(OR=8.35，95%CI：4.47~15.58)；因此，在急性肢体缺血患者，起始手术治疗或者溶栓治疗对于保肢或死亡均无明显差异，但起始溶栓治疗会使肢体缺血与出血并发症风险增加。

sentences.sentence_en: (3) Anticoagulants (heparin, low molecular weight heparin and oral anticoagulants): There is no clear evidence to support the use of anticoagulant therapy in the intermittent claudication stage of diabetic foot. Compared with aspirin alone, low molecular weight heparin combined with aspirin can significantly reduce vascular occlusion/restenosis (up to 85%) in patients with severe limb ischemia who have undergone minimally invasive endovascular treatment (balloon dilatation and stent implantation) (OR=0.15, 95%CI: 0.06-0.42, P=0.0003); while batroxobin combined with aspirin significantly reduced restenosis in diabetic patients (OR=0.28, 95%CI: 0.13-0.60), without a significant increase in bleeding and other gastrointestinal adverse events.

sentences.sentence_en: In the initial treatment of acute limb ischemia, there was no statistically significant difference between initial surgery or thrombolytic therapy in terms of limb salvage or death at 30 days, 6 months or 1 year; however, the 30-day stroke rate in the initial thrombolytic therapy group (1.3%) was significantly higher than that in the initial surgical treatment group (0%) (OR=6.41, 95%CI: 1.57-26.22); the 30-day major bleeding rates were 8.8% and 3.3%, respectively (OR=2.80, 95%CI: 1.70-4.60), and the distal embolism rates were 12.4% and 0%, respectively (OR=8.35, 95%CI: 4.47-15.58); therefore, in patients with acute limb ischemia, there was no significant difference between initial surgery or thrombolytic therapy in terms of limb salvage or death, but initial thrombolytic therapy would increase the risk of limb ischemia and bleeding complications.

paragraphs.paragraph_en: (3) Anticoagulants (heparin, low molecular weight heparin and oral anticoagulants): There is no clear evidence to support the use of anticoagulant therapy in the intermittent claudication stage of diabetic foot. Compared with aspirin alone, low molecular weight heparin combined with aspirin can significantly reduce vascular occlusion/restenosis (up to 85%) in patients with severe limb ischemia who have undergone minimally invasive endovascular treatment (balloon dilatation and stent implantation) (OR=0.15, 95%CI: 0.06-0.42, P=0.0003); while batroxobin combined with aspirin significantly reduced restenosis in diabetic patients (OR=0.28, 95%CI: 0.13-0.60), without a significant increase in bleeding and other gastrointestinal adverse events. In the initial treatment of acute limb ischemia, there was no statistically significant difference between initial surgery or thrombolytic therapy in terms of limb salvage or death at 30 days, 6 months or 1 year; however, the 30-day stroke rate in the initial thrombolytic therapy group (1.3%) was significantly higher than that in the initial surgical treatment group (0%) (OR=6.41, 95%CI: 1.57-26.22); the 30-day major bleeding rates were 8.8% and 3.3%, respectively (OR=2.80, 95%CI: 1.70-4.60), and the distal embolism rates were 12.4% and 0%, respectively (OR=8.35, 95%CI: 4.47-15.58); therefore, in patients with acute limb ischemia, there was no significant difference between initial surgery or thrombolytic therapy in terms of limb salvage or death, but initial thrombolytic therapy would increase the risk of limb ischemia and bleeding complications.

Therefore, for patients with severe ischemia who are ineffective with conventional medical treatment, percutaneous interventional treatment or surgical treatment is required.

paragraphs.paragraph: 3.干细胞移植：干细胞目前尚不能作为治疗糖尿病下肢血管病变的常规手段，国内外研究报道干细胞移植治疗下肢血管病变有一定疗效。目前干细胞移植包括自体和异体移植，是最近十多年发展起来的新技术。自体干细胞移植在国内得到一定程度的普及，取得了良好的效果。目前干细胞的来源有骨髓、外周血和改良的骨髓3种方法。自体干细胞至少有2个优点：(1)不存在免疫排斥；(2)没有胚胎干细胞的伦理问题。异体干细胞主要包括脐血、间充质和胚胎干细胞，前两者在临床上已经有比较好的结果。但是限于国家政策，异体干细胞移植需要有一定的资质，目前处于临床研究阶段，有条件的单位可根据情况决定是否选择。此外，干细胞联合凝胶可以修复糖尿病足的创面，临床上技术尚不完全成熟，建议有条件单位要谨慎开展。

sentences.sentence_en: 3. Stem cell transplantation: Stem cells are not currently a routine treatment for diabetic lower limb vascular disease. Domestic and foreign studies have reported that stem cell transplantation has a certain effect in treating lower limb vascular disease. Currently, stem cell transplantation includes autologous and allogeneic transplantation, which is a new technology developed in the past decade. Autologous stem cell transplantation has been popularized to a certain extent in China and has achieved good results. Currently, there are three sources of stem cells: bone marrow, peripheral blood, and modified bone marrow. Autologous stem cells have at least two advantages: (1) there is no immune rejection; (2) there are no ethical issues of embryonic stem cells. Allogeneic stem cells mainly include umbilical cord blood, mesenchymal and embryonic stem cells. The first two have shown relatively good results in clinical practice. However, due to national policies, allogeneic stem cell transplantation requires certain qualifications. It is currently in the clinical research stage. Units with conditions can decide whether to choose it according to the situation. In addition, stem cells combined with gel can repair the wound surface of diabetic foot. The technology is not yet fully mature in clinical practice. It is recommended that units with conditions should be cautious in carrying out the transplantation.

Allogeneic stem cells mainly include umbilical cord blood, mesenchymal and embryonic stem cells. The first two have shown relatively good results in clinical practice. However, due to national policies, allogeneic stem cell transplantation requires certain qualifications. It is currently in the clinical research stage. Units with conditions can decide whether to choose it according to the situation. In addition, stem cells combined with gel can repair the wound surface of diabetic foot. The technology is not yet fully mature in clinical practice. It is recommended that units with conditions should be cautious in carrying out the transplantation.

sentences.sentence_en: (3) Wound medication: Wound medication should be selected according to the different stages of the wound. If the necrotic tissue of the wound has been dissolved and the basal granulation tissue has begun to proliferate, disinfectants and bactericidal drugs and growth-promoting drugs can be used in combination.

paragraphs.paragraph: (2)创面清创手术的适应证：①已发生明确的足趾、足掌、肢体坏疽创面；②坏死性筋膜炎急性炎症期的创面；③形成足底筋膜、肌膜间隙脓肿的创面：④形成感染性窦道的创面；⑤肌腱、骨骼等深部组织外露失活，换药难以去除的创面；⑥残存大量坏死组织的创面；⑦创面基底肉芽组织增生，无深部组织外露，达到植皮条件而通过换药1个月内难以愈合的创面。

sentences.sentence_en: (2) Indications for wound debridement surgery: ① Wounds with clear gangrene of the toes, soles, and limbs; ② Wounds in the acute inflammatory stage of necrotizing fasciitis; ③ Wounds with abscesses in the plantar fascia and interfascial space; ④ Wounds with infected sinuses; ⑤ Wounds with exposed and inactive deep tissues such as tendons and bones that are difficult to remove with dressing changes; ⑥ Wounds with a large amount of residual necrotic tissue; ⑦ Wounds with hyperplasia of granulation tissue at the base of the wound, no exposure of deep tissues, and conditions for skin grafting but difficult to heal within 1 month with dressing changes.

paragraphs.paragraph_en: (2) Indications for wound debridement surgery: ① Wounds with clear gangrene of the toes, soles, and limbs; ② Wounds in the acute inflammatory stage of necrotizing fasciitis; ③ Wounds with abscesses in the plantar fascia and interfascial space; ④ Wounds with infected sinuses; ⑤ Wounds with exposed and inactive deep tissues such as tendons and bones that are difficult to remove with dressing changes; ⑥ Wounds with a large amount of residual necrotic tissue; ⑦ Wounds with hyperplasia of granulation tissue at the base of the wound, no exposure of deep tissues, and conditions for skin grafting but difficult to heal within 1 month with dressing changes.

paragraphs.paragraph: (3)手术方式的选择：尽可能优先选择简单、维发损伤小的手术方案，争取以简单方法解决复杂问题。①止血带：疑似血运障碍者，建议慎用止血带。②清创术：注意探查深层组织损伤情况，避免肌肉组织夹心样坏死和骨筋膜间室综合征，术后能够通畅引流；建议通过多次清创的手术方式，避免损伤过多健康组织，对无明确坏死表现的骨质应尽可能保全。③缝合术：不推荐清创后一期缝合。④植皮术：创面基底达到植皮条件，应尽早手术封闭创面。建议优先选择刃厚皮植皮，能够选择游离皮片移植的不需选择皮瓣移植。⑤皮瓣移植术：因糖尿病足患者多双下肢同步发生血管缺血性病变，故不推荐皮瓣转移移植手术，以避免出现皮瓣修复失败甚至供瓣区愈合不良。需在术前对术区血管详细检查评估的前提下，制定手术方案，选择皮瓣的优先顺序为邻位、远位、带蒂、游离。⑥截肢/趾术：对坏死肢体感染危及生命、血供无法重建、创面难以愈合、因疼痛难以忍受，患者家庭经济状况难以坚持长期非手术治疗而强烈要求者，可进行截肢治疗。⑦截肢平面选择：一般可根据患者全身状况、局部供血和损伤情况决定截胶平面，争取达到残端一期愈合的情况下保留患肢功能。目前临床上使用比较广泛的是采用经皮氧分压测定(也可结合血管影像学检查)，一般来讲，组织的经皮氧分压<20mmHg时，预示着截肢残端无法愈合；经皮氧分压>40mmHg时，预示着戴肢残端可以愈合；介于二者之间有愈合的可能，可能需要采用增加血流的方法。

sentences.sentence_en: (3) Choice of surgical method: Give priority to simple surgical methods with minimal damage to the uterus, and try to solve complex problems with simple methods. ① Tourniquet: It is recommended to use tourniquets with caution in patients with suspected blood flow disorders. ② Debridement: Pay attention to the exploration of deep tissue damage, avoid sandwich necrosis of muscle tissue and compartment syndrome, and ensure smooth drainage after surgery; it is recommended to use multiple debridements to avoid excessive damage to healthy tissue, and preserve bones without clear necrosis as much as possible. ③ Suturing: Primary suture after debridement is not recommended. ④ Skin grafting: When the wound base meets the conditions for skin grafting, the wound should be closed surgically as soon as possible. It is recommended to give priority to blade-thickness skin grafting, and flap transplantation is not necessary if free skin grafting can be selected. ⑤ Flap transplantation: Because diabetic foot patients often have synchronous vascular ischemic lesions in both lower limbs, flap transfer and transplantation surgery is not recommended to avoid flap repair failure or even poor healing of the donor area. The surgical plan should be formulated based on the detailed examination and evaluation of the blood vessels in the surgical area before the operation. The priority order of flap selection is adjacent, distal, pedicled, and free. ⑥ Amputation/toe surgery: Amputation can be performed for patients with life-threatening infection of necrotic limbs, inability to reconstruct blood supply, difficulty in wound healing, unbearable pain, and strong requests from patients whose family economic conditions make it difficult to adhere to long-term non-surgical treatment.

sentences.sentence: ⑦截肢平面选择：一般可根据患者全身状况、局部供血和损伤情况决定截胶平面，争取达到残端一期愈合的情况下保留患肢功能。
sentences.sentence_en: ⑦ Selection of amputation plane: Generally, the amputation plane can be determined based on the patient's general condition, local blood supply and injury conditions, and the function of the affected limb should be retained while achieving primary healing of the stump.

sentences.sentence: 目前临床上使用比较广泛的是采用经皮氧分压测定(也可结合血管影像学检查)，一般来讲，组织的经皮氧分压<20mmHg时，预示着截肢残端无法愈合；经皮氧分压>40mmHg时，预示着戴肢残端可以愈合；介于二者之间有愈合的可能，可能需要采用增加血流的方法。
sentences.sentence_en: Currently, the most widely used method in clinical practice is transcutaneous oxygen partial pressure measurement (which can also be combined with vascular imaging examination). Generally speaking, when the transcutaneous oxygen partial pressure of the tissue is <20 mmHg, it indicates that the amputation stump cannot heal; when the transcutaneous oxygen partial pressure is >40 mmHg, it indicates that the amputation stump can heal; if it is between the two, there is a possibility of healing, and methods to increase blood flow may be needed.

paragraphs.paragraph_en: (3) Choice of surgical method: Give priority to simple surgical methods with minimal damage to the uterus, and try to solve complex problems with simple methods. ① Tourniquet: It is recommended to use tourniquets with caution in patients with suspected blood flow disorders. ② Debridement: Pay attention to the exploration of deep tissue damage, avoid sandwich necrosis of muscle tissue and osteofascial compartment syndrome, and ensure smooth drainage after surgery; it is recommended to use multiple debridements to avoid damaging too much healthy tissue, and preserve as much bone as possible without clear necrosis. ③ Suturing: Primary suture after debridement is not recommended. ④ Skin grafting: When the wound base meets the conditions for skin grafting, the wound should be closed surgically as soon as possible. It is recommended to give priority to blade-thickness skin grafting, and flap transplantation is not necessary if free skin grafting can be selected. ⑤ Flap transplantation: Because diabetic foot patients often have synchronous vascular ischemic lesions in both lower limbs, flap transfer and transplantation surgery is not recommended to avoid flap repair failure or even poor healing of the donor area. The surgical plan should be formulated on the premise of a detailed examination and evaluation of the blood vessels in the surgical area before the operation. The priority order of flap selection is adjacent, distal, pedicled, and free. ⑥ Amputation/toe surgery: Amputation can be performed for patients with life-threatening infection of necrotic limbs, inability to reconstruct blood supply, difficulty in wound healing, unbearable pain, and strong demands for long-term non-surgical treatment due to the economic conditions of the patient's family. ⑦ Selection of amputation plane: Generally, the amputation plane can be determined based on the patient's general condition, local blood supply, and injury, and the function of the affected limb can be retained while achieving primary healing of the stump. At present, the most widely used method in clinical practice is the measurement of transcutaneous oxygen partial pressure (which can also be combined with vascular imaging examination). Generally speaking, when the transcutaneous oxygen partial pressure of the tissue is <20mmHg, it indicates that the amputated stump cannot heal; when the transcutaneous oxygen partial pressure is >40mmHg, it indicates that the stump can heal; between the two, there is a possibility of healing, and methods to increase blood flow may be needed.

paragraphs.paragraph: 西洛他唑是一种强效磷酸二酯Ⅲ抑制剂，2007年被泛大西洋协作组织(TASC) Ⅱ指南推荐作为治疗间歇性跛行的一线药物。在糖尿病足的治疗中，西洛他唑既可以抑制血小板的聚集，防止血栓形成；另一方面，也能够通过扩张血管的作用，增加狭窄动脉的血流量，改善患肢取血状态。西洛他唑的应用可以大幅延迟糖尿病患者截肢的发生，并且改善糖尿病足患者下肢动脉缺血的情况。一般来讲，24周的西洛他唑(100mg，2次/d)治疗可以有效预防糖尿病足者发生溃疡；经8周的西洛他唑(100mg，2次/d)治疗，2型糖尿病下肢缺血患者的经皮氧分压、间歇性跛行、肢体冷感以及疼痛感等显著改善且优于阿司匹林，给予西洛他唑100mg与50mg，2次/d，其无痛性跛行距离均有较好的改善(WMD=31.4lm，95%CI：22.38~40.45m，P<0.00001； WMD=19.89m，95%CI：9.44~30.34m，P=0.0002)，最大跛行距离也有明显改善(WMD=43.12m，95% CI：18.28~67.96m，P=0.0007；WMD=32.00m，95%CI：14.17~49.83m，P=0.0004)，提示西洛他唑能够改善下肢动脉粥样硬化性病变(LEAD) 患者的步行距离，但目前没有足够的证据证明服用西洛他唑能够降低全因病死率和心血管事件或者改善患者的生活质量。此外，经血管腔内微创治疗(球囊扩张及支架植入) 的LEAD患者，西洛他唑治疗较噻氯匹啶有更少的再闭塞发生(OR=0.32，95%CI：0.13~0.76，P=0.01)，且西洛他唑治疗是预防血管再狭窄的独立预测因子。西洛他唑的不良反应主要有头痛、腹泻、大便异常、头晕以及心悸，但症状轻微可以忍受，严重不良事件包括心血管事件及死亡率与安慰剂相比并没有增加，但长期有效性尚不明确。西洛他唑的推荐剂量为50~100mg/次，2次/d。

entities.entity_en: Minimally invasive endovascular treatment (balloon dilatation and stent implantation)

sentences.sentence_en: Cilostazol is a potent phosphodiester III inhibitor, which was recommended as a first-line drug for the treatment of intermittent claudication by the Trans-Atlantic Collaboration (TASC) II guidelines in 2007. In the treatment of diabetic foot, cilostazol can inhibit platelet aggregation and prevent thrombosis; on the other hand, it can also increase blood flow in narrowed arteries and improve blood collection in the affected limbs by dilating blood vessels. The use of cilostazol can significantly delay the occurrence of amputation in diabetic patients and improve the ischemia of lower limb arteries in patients with diabetic foot. Generally speaking, 24 weeks of cilostazol (100 mg, twice a day) treatment can effectively prevent diabetic foot ulcers; after 8 weeks of cilostazol (100 mg, twice a day) treatment, the transcutaneous oxygen partial pressure, intermittent claudication, limb coldness and pain in patients with type 2 diabetes lower limb ischemia were significantly improved and better than aspirin. The painless claudication distance was significantly improved after giving cilostazol 100 mg and 50 mg, twice a day (WMD=31.41m, 95%CI: 22.38~40.45m, P<0.00001; WMD=19.89m, 95%CI: 9.44~30.34m, P=0.0002), and the maximum claudication distance was also significantly improved (WMD=43.12m, 95%CI: CI: 18.28~67.96m, P=0.0007; WMD=32.00m, 95%CI: 14.17~49.83m, P=0.0004), indicating that cilostazol can improve the walking distance of patients with lower extremity atherosclerotic disease (LEAD), but there is currently insufficient evidence to prove that taking cilostazol can reduce all-cause mortality and cardiovascular events or improve patients' quality of life. In addition, LEAD patients who underwent minimally invasive endovascular treatment (balloon dilatation and stent implantation) had less reocclusion with cilostazol than with ticlopidine (OR=0.32, 95%CI: 0.13~0.76, P=0.01), and cilostazol treatment was an independent predictor of preventing vascular restenosis. The main adverse reactions of cilostazol include headache, diarrhea, abnormal stool, dizziness and palpitations, but the symptoms are mild and tolerable. Serious adverse events including cardiovascular events and mortality are not increased compared with placebo, but the long-term effectiveness is still unclear.

sentences.sentence: 西洛他唑的推荐剂量为50~100mg/次，2次/d。
sentences.sentence_en: The recommended dose of cilostazol is 50~100 mg/time, twice/day.

paragraphs.paragraph_en: Cilostazol is a potent phosphodiester III inhibitor, which was recommended as a first-line drug for the treatment of intermittent claudication by the Trans-Atlantic Collaboration (TASC) II guidelines in 2007. In the treatment of diabetic foot, cilostazol can inhibit platelet aggregation and prevent thrombosis; on the other hand, it can also increase blood flow in narrowed arteries and improve blood collection in the affected limbs by dilating blood vessels. The use of cilostazol can significantly delay the occurrence of amputation in diabetic patients and improve the ischemia of lower limb arteries in patients with diabetic foot. Generally speaking, 24 weeks of cilostazol (100 mg, twice a day) treatment can effectively prevent diabetic foot ulcers; after 8 weeks of cilostazol (100 mg, twice a day) treatment, the transcutaneous oxygen partial pressure, intermittent claudication, limb coldness and pain in patients with type 2 diabetes lower limb ischemia were significantly improved and better than aspirin. The painless claudication distance was significantly improved after giving cilostazol 100 mg and 50 mg, twice a day (WMD=31.41m, 95%CI: 22.38~40.45m, P<0.00001; WMD=19.89m, 95%CI: 9.44~30.34m, P=0.0002), and the maximum claudication distance was also significantly improved (WMD=43.12m, 95%CI: CI: 18.28~67.96m, P=0.0007; WMD=32.00m, 95%CI: 14.17~49.83m, P=0.0004), indicating that cilostazol can improve the walking distance of patients with lower extremity atherosclerotic disease (LEAD), but there is currently insufficient evidence to prove that taking cilostazol can reduce all-cause mortality and cardiovascular events or improve patients' quality of life. In addition, LEAD patients who underwent minimally invasive endovascular treatment (balloon dilatation and stent implantation) had less reocclusion with cilostazol than with ticlopidine (OR=0.32, 95%CI: 0.13~0.76, P=0.01), and cilostazol treatment was an independent predictor of preventing vascular restenosis. The main adverse reactions of cilostazol include headache, diarrhea, abnormal stool, dizziness and palpitations, but the symptoms are mild and tolerable. Serious adverse events including cardiovascular events and mortality did not increase compared with placebo, but the long-term effectiveness is still unclear. The recommended dose of cilostazol is 50~100mg/time, twice/day.

paragraphs.paragraph: 5.血管影像检查：包括动脉彩色多普勒超声检查、CT血管造影(CTA) 、磁共振血管造影(MRA) 和数字减影血管造影(DSA)血管彩色多普勒检查具有无创、简便的特点，可以了解动脉硬化斑块状况及有无动脉狭窄或闭塞，适用于血管病变大范围筛查。 CTA和MR A具有成像清晰的特点，可以显示血管有无狭窄或闭塞，但准确率低于DSA。对于肾功能正常者，CTA目前可作为糖尿病足下肢血管病变的首选影像学检查手段。DSA仍是诊断下肢血管病变的金标准，可以准确显示动脉堵塞状况及侧支循环建立情况，对外科治疗方案的选择有重要作用。

sentences.sentence_en: 5. Vascular imaging examination: including arterial color Doppler ultrasound examination, CT angiography (CTA), magnetic resonance angiography (MRA) and digital subtraction angiography (DSA). Vascular color Doppler examination is non-invasive and simple. It can understand the status of arteriosclerotic plaques and whether there is arterial stenosis or occlusion. It is suitable for large-scale screening of vascular lesions. CTA and MR A have the characteristics of clear imaging and can show whether there is stenosis or occlusion of blood vessels, but the accuracy is lower than DSA. For those with normal renal function, CTA can currently be used as the preferred imaging examination method for diabetic foot lower limb vascular lesions. DSA is still the gold standard for diagnosing lower limb vascular lesions. It can accurately show the status of arterial blockage and the establishment of collateral circulation, and plays an important role in the selection of surgical treatment options.
